passages.text: EQUITY: AUTOS & AUTO PARTS
1H25 EPS softened due to key client's lackluster demand; liquid cooling and robotics to support long- term EPS growth

1H25 EPS declined y- y due to key client's lackluster shipmentsTuopu reported 1H25 results on 28 Aug after market close and hosted an investor and analyst meeting on 29 Aug. 1H25 revenue increased \(6\%\) y- y to CNY12,935mn, \(2\%\) higher than our estimate, mainly supported by \(+52\% /22\% /12\%\) y- y sales growth of electronics, electric drive system, and interior. 1H25 EPS declined \(11\%\) y- y to CNY1,295mn, \(5\%\) higher than our estimate, which was mainly caused by a 1.8bp gross margin decline to \(19.6\%\) due to increased depreciation and an increase in its opex ratio to \(9.4\%\) (vs \(8.1\%\) in 1H24) on growing R&D investments.

Domestic OEMs growth could offset key client shipment decline; liquid cooling and robotics support EPS long- term growthFor 2H25 outlook, 1) we think the growing demand from domestic OEMs such as Xiaomi (1810 HK, Neutral), which are poised to sustain robust shipment growth, could offset the lackluster volume shipments of Toupu's key client. 2) We expect the recent acquisition and consolidation of Wuhu Changpeng's (Unlisted) operations to provide incremental sales and earnings tailwinds, bolstering Toupu's topline contributions and margin stability. Further, 3) we believe the company's foray into liquid cooling solutions, including self- developed products such as pumps, temperature- pressure sensors, control valves, gas- liquid separators, and diverters, positions it well for diversification, with CNY1.7bn in secured orders and ongoing engagements with tier- 1 suppliers and key clients such as Huawei (Unlisted), Nvidia (NVDA US, Not rated), and Meta (META US, Not rated); this segment is likely to emerge as a meaningful new growth driver over the medium to long term. In addition, 4) Tuopu's humanoid robot initiatives are likely to track toward mass production in 2026F, while its entrenched market share with core client underscores sustained competitive advantages and potential for multi- year revenue/earnings upside.

We maintain our Buy rating for Tuopu and increase the TP to CNY75 (from CNY55) to reflect our positive read- on liquid cooling's long- term growth. We adjust 2025/26F EPS forecasts to CNY1.78bn (from CNY1.81/2.01), factoring in key client's lackluster shipment in 1H25 and likely increasing contributions from domestic OEMs in 2H25/2026F. Our TP of CNY75 is based on 38x 2026F P/E (previously 27x 2026F P/E), at \(+2.7x\) SD of its historical P/E. The stock currently trades at 32x 2026F P/E.
Source: Company data, Nomura estimates

Ningbo Tuopu Group Co., Ltd. founded in 1983 and headquartered in Ningbo, China, is a leading automotive components supplier specializing in chassis systems, lightweight parts, thermal management, and smart driving solutions for new energy vehicles.

We use P/E method to value Tuopu and our TP of CNY5 is based on 38x 2026F P/E, at \(+2.7x\) SD of its historical average at 19x, which we believe is well supported by our 2025- 27F earnings CAGR of \(15\%\) . The benchmark index is CSI300.
Downside risks include: 1) lackluster shipment from key clients; and 2) slower mass production schedule from humanoid robot firms.

Tuopu fits the ESG theme, as 1) its products focus on lightweight solutions (e.g. aluminum alloy parts), which contribute to improved fuel efficiency and reduced emissions; 2) its offers thermal management systems, which supports the transition to cleaner energy by optimizing battery and motor efficiency; and 3) the company focus on EV component, suggesting alignment with industry trends toward lower environment impact.

Fig. 2: Forward P/S with -2/+2x SD

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia. Ningbo Tuopu Group Co
